results.title: Black sun
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, Amanda Jane and Hugh Burton
results.brief_description: The story begins and ends with a funeral. A group of female friends unite for a night of drugs, music and memories under the full moon. One of the girls has been away to the city, and discovers that things don’t stay the same, that friendships change, and can be challenged and proven very quickly. Cast includes Raelee Hill and Brigid Kelly.

results.title: Black sickness, black cure (A)
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Holmes and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Four corners (Television program)”.
Aboriginal health is notoriously bad, including high rates of alcoholism, infant mortality and leprosy, a disease which has almost disappeared from the western world. The program looks at ways the Aborigines are beginning to take control of their own health services, ultimately hoping to combine western medicine with their own bush remedies and holistic approach to the issue of health. Chris Masters reports on some of the initiatives, successful and unsuccessful, to blend the two.

results.title: Black scour worm
results.creator_credit: Tom Price and Australian Wool Corporation
results.brief_description: This film, deals with the prevention and control of the black scour worm, a parasitic worm which occurs in sheep, cattle, goats and rabbits.The infection is usually picked up in the autumn when feed is short, and symptoms occur in winter: a wet autumn and a dry winter is particularly dangerous. The film stresses that whilst it is almost impossible to eradicate the infection, it is possible to control it to such an extent that economic loss is prevented. The importance of drenching early, when the sheep are fat, is stressed; breeding ewes should be drenched before lambing, especially before autumn lambing, so that the lambs do not become heavily infected; lambs should be drenched at weaning; drenching should be done fairly regularly every four to five weeks from autumn until spring, the wetter the season the more frequent should the treatment be. The film ends by stressing that pastoralists should try to check the growth of the black scour worms long before the sheep show any symptoms of the disease. Narrated by Bob Pollard.

The film ends by stressing that pastoralists should try to check the growth of the black scour worms long before the sheep show any symptoms of the disease. Narrated by Bob Pollard.

The film ends by stressing that pastoralists should try to check the growth of the black scour worms long before the sheep show any symptoms of the disease. Narrated by Bob Pollard.

results.title: Black Samson
results.creator_credit: Daniel B. Cady, Warner Bros Pictures, Omni Pictures and Charles Bail
results.brief_description: One of the more conscientious and political ‘right on’ of the Blaxploitation genre, Charles Bail’s (‘Cleopatra Jones and the Casino of gold’) ‘Black Samson’ stars Rockne Tarkington as Samson, a community minded nightclub owner whose softly spoken voice and peaceful demure doesn’t deter him from sticking it to the ‘man’ when drugs invade his inner city neighbourhood. His saintly like persona is further enhanced by the staff he carries with him everywhere, which also happens to be a deadly weapon when needed. Samson’s patience is tested when the mafia begin to recruit some of the black gangs in his hood to help them distribute drugs in the area. Things get personal however when the mob rough-up his girlfriend in order to dissuade him from interfering with their racket. Naturally all hell breaks loose as Samson bands with his neighbourhood to combat the drug menace and settle his personal score. Cast also includes William Smith, Connie Strickland, Michael Payne and Carol Speed.

results.title: Black robe
results.creator_credit: Alliance, Samson, Robert Lantos, Stephane Reichel, Sue Milliken and Bruce Beresford
results.brief_description: Based on Canadian author Brian Moore’s acclaimed novel, this is the brutal and breathtaking story of two men and their journey deep into the heart of the rugged Canadian wilderness. Struggling to survive, they face the savagery of the native Indians, the perils of their 1,500 mile trek and the hardships of the hostile land. Acclaimed director Bruce Beresford has created an ultimate adventure, a bold and brave story of courageous men journeying into a dangerous land. Stars Lothaire Bluteau and Aden Young.

results.title: Black rain
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Stanley R. Jaffe, Sherry Lansing and Ridley Scott
results.brief_description: Nick Conklin, (Michael Douglas) and Charlie Douglas, (Andy Garcia) are strangers in a strange land. They are New York City cops in Japan, chasing Sato, (Yasuka Matsuda), an escaped murderer and a member of the Yakuza, (the Japanese Mafia). Director Ridley Scott takes the viewer on nightmare journey through the exotic, violent streets of Osaka, into the very heart of the deadly Yakuza. This fascinating thriller tells of men torn by a clash of culture and crime against honour.

results.title: Black people power
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Kelvin Onus-King and ACMI
results.brief_description: Kevin Onus-King learnt that ‘you only get what you want when you fight for it’ and he learnt this in more ways than one over the years. He takes us back through the history of Indigenous activists in Fitzroy and how this area was a hot bed of political activity as he was growing up. He later became strongly involved in the fight for better conditions and has taken that fight across Australia.

results.title: Black patch
results.creator_credit: Thomas J. Brandon and Central Documentary Films
results.brief_description: A breathtaking story of animal adventure which will arouse children’s sympathy for wild animals, teach them about animals’ adaptation to particular geographic conditions, and show them authentic pictures of a strange place, full of wonder and beauty. Set in the ice-clad Tian-Shan range in central Asia, the story of Black Patch, the little goat, is told - how he grows up to lead the wild herd of mountain goats to safety in their flight from wolves and hunters. (Features a white panther with markings similar to a jaguar or leopard as one of the predators of the goats.)

results.title: Black Orpheus = Orfeu negro
results.creator_credit: Sacha Gordine, Lopert Films and Marcel Camus
results.brief_description: Orfeu Negro is an transposition of the story of Orpheus and Euridyce to the modern city of Rio da Janeiro during the Carnival. It is interpreted by a cast of non-professional actors. (Awards: Cannes Film Festival 1959 - Palme d’or ; Academy Awards 1959 - Best Foreign Film) Cast includes Breno Higeno-Mello, Marpessa Dawn, Lourdes de Oliveira, Lea Garcia, Alexandro Constantino, Waldemar da Souza, Jorge Dos Santos and Aurino Cassanio. In Portugese with English subtitles.

results.title: Black on white
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Arts Council of Great Britain and John Read
results.brief_description: A selection of 200 illustrations are used in this survey of cartoon and caricature in Britain over the past 250 years. In dealing with the present century the film shows work by artists such as Bateman, Port, Fougasse, Ronald Searle, Osbert Lancaster, Gibs, Vicky and David Low. Low is shown at work on a cartoon of Clement Attlee and Sir Winston Churchill. Other artists whose work is featured include James Gillroy, Thomas Rowlandson, George Cruikshank, Charles Keene, George du Maurier, John Tenneil, Phil May and Max Beerbohm.
